Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Jill Karofsky was not involved in the 1999 sexual assault case until after the defendant was convicted and sentenced.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates Karofsky's involvement in the case by stating that she "went easy on" the defendant when she was not the prosecutor at the time.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by falsely attributing the actions of the previous prosecutor to Karofsky.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on online court records that only list the most recent prosecutor, rather than the actual prosecutor at the time of the case.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the online court records accurately reflect the involvement of all prosecutors in the case.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
